alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hansford; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 18 at 2:40PM CDT until April 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHWEST OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND WEST AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTHWEST OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND WEST AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. For tomorrow, higher gusts up to 40 mph will be possible in the west. * Relative Humidity...For today and tomorrow, as low as 5 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today and tomorrow, 4 to 7. * Timing...For the Red Flag Warning, through 9 PM CDT tonight. For the Fire Weather Watch, 12 PM to 9 PM CDT, Wednesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
